title: PyTorch segfaults in combination with onnx on Ubuntu 16.04 with Python 3
body_html:
On Ubuntu 16.04 with

virtualenv -p python3 .env
. .env/bin/activate

pip install onnx torch

The following segfaults from within PyTorch's native code:

python3 -c 'import onnx; import torch'

Here is a backtrace I extracted from GDB

#0  0x0000000000e244d0 in ?? ()
#1  0x00007fffdf5c04e0 in pybind11::detail::make_new_python_type (rec=...)
    at /pytorch/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/detail/class.h:564
#2  0x00007fffdf5c1ff0 in pybind11::detail::generic_type::initialize (this=0x7fffffffba60, rec=...)
    at /pytorch/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/pybind11.h:887
#3  0x00007fffdfb4871c in pybind11::class_<torch::jit::InterpreterFunctionFactory, std::shared_ptr<torch::jit::InterpreterFunctionFactory> >::class_<> (name=0x7fffdff6a8bf "InterpreterFunctionFactory", 
    scope=..., this=0x7fffffffba60) at /pytorch/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/pybind11.h:1065
#4  torch::autograd::initAutogradClosureBindings (module=0x7fffe82bfea8)
    at torch/csrc/autograd/functions/init.cpp:127
#5  0x00007fffdf5226c6 in initModule () at torch/csrc/Module.cpp:490
#6  PyInit () at torch/csrc/Module.cpp:595
#7  0x000000000061004e in _PyImport_LoadDynamicModuleWithSpec ()
#8  0x0000000000610538 in ?? ()
#9  0x00000000004e9c36 in PyCFunction_Call ()
#10 0x000000000053dbbb in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#11 0x0000000000540199 in ?? ()
#12 0x000000000053c1d0 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#13 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#14 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#15 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#16 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#17 0x0000000000540f9b in PyEval_EvalCodeEx ()
#18 0x00000000004ebd23 in ?? ()
#19 0x00000000005c1797 in PyObject_Call ()
#20 0x00000000005c257a in _PyObject_CallMethodIdObjArgs ()
#21 0x00000000005260c8 in PyImport_ImportModuleLevelObject ()
#22 0x0000000000549e78 in ?? ()
#23 0x00000000004e9ba7 in PyCFunction_Call ()
#24 0x00000000005c1797 in PyObject_Call ()
#25 0x0000000000534d90 in PyEval_CallObjectWithKeywords ()
#26 0x000000000053a1c7 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#27 0x0000000000540199 in ?? ()
#28 0x0000000000540e4f in PyEval_EvalCode ()
#29 0x000000000054a6b8 in ?? ()
#30 0x00000000004e9c36 in PyCFunction_Call ()
#31 0x000000000053dbbb in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#32 0x0000000000540199 in ?? ()
#33 0x000000000053c1d0 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#34 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#35 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#36 0x000000000053b7e4 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#37 0x0000000000540f9b in PyEval_EvalCodeEx ()
#38 0x00000000004ebd23 in ?? ()
#39 0x00000000005c1797 in PyObject_Call ()
#40 0x00000000005c257a in _PyObject_CallMethodIdObjArgs ()
#41 0x00000000005260c8 in PyImport_ImportModuleLevelObject ()
#42 0x0000000000549e78 in ?? ()
#43 0x00000000004e9ba7 in PyCFunction_Call ()
#44 0x00000000005c1797 in PyObject_Call ()
#45 0x0000000000534d90 in PyEval_CallObjectWithKeywords ()
#46 0x000000000053a1c7 in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
#47 0x0000000000540199 in ?? ()
#48 0x0000000000540e4f in PyEval_EvalCode ()
#49 0x0000000000520d4f in PyRun_StringFlags ()
#50 0x000000000060e88c in PyRun_SimpleStringFlags ()
#51 0x000000000063fc51 in Py_Main ()
#52 0x00000000004cfeb1 in main ()

Is there any other way I can help?

System Info

With onnx==1.2.1 and

Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.5
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.14.5)
[pip3] torch (0.4.0)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] Could not collect

On Ubuntu 16.04 with
virtualenv -p python3 .env
. .env/bin/activate

pip install onnx torch

The following segfaults from within PyTorch's native code:
python3 -c 'import onnx; import torch'

Here is a backtrace I extracted from GDB

#0  0x0000000000e244d0 in ?? ()

body:
On Ubuntu 16.04 with

    virtualenv -p python3 .env
    . .env/bin/activate

    pip install onnx torch

The following segfaults from within PyTorch's native code:

    python3 -c 'import onnx; import torch'

Here is a backtrace I extracted from GDB
<details>

```
#0  0x0000000000e244d0 in ?? ()
#1  0x00007fffdf5c04e0 in pybind11::detail::make_new_python_type (rec=...)
    at /pytorch/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/detail/class.h:564
#2  0x00007fffdf5c1ff0 in pybind11::detail::generic_type::initialize (this=0x7fffffffba60, rec=...)
    at /pytorch/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/pybind11.h:887

    scope=..., this=0x7fffffffba60) at /pytorch/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/pybind11.h:1065
#4  torch::autograd::initAutogradClosureBindings (module=0x7fffe82bfea8)
    at torch/csrc/autograd/functions/init.cpp:127
```

Is there any other way I can help?
